verse.#text: So he went and took Gomer, the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.

#text: Call his name Jezreel, for in just a little while
I will punish the house of Jehu for the blood of Jezreel, and
I will put an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
I will break the bow of Israel
She conceived again and bore a daughter. And the
I will no more have mercy on the house of Israel, to forgive them at all.
I will have mercy on the house of Judah, and I will save them by the
will not save them by bow or by sword or by war or by horses or by horsemen.

verse.#text: When she had weaned No Mercy, she conceived and bore a son.

#text: Call his name Not My People,
you are not my people, and I am not your God.
the number of the children of Israel shall be
like the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured or numbered.
in the place where it was said to them,
it shall be said to them,
the children of Judah and the children of Israel shall be gathered together, and
they shall appoint for themselves one head. And they shall go up from the land, for great shall be the day of Jezreel.
and I am not her husband—
and her adultery from between her breasts;
in the day she was born,
and make her like a parched land,
Upon her children also I will have no mercy,
because they are children of whoredom.
their mother has played the whore;
she who conceived them has acted shamefully.
I will go after my lovers,
give me my bread and my water,
my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.
I will build a wall against her,
so that she cannot find her paths.
I will go and return to
for it was better for me then than now.
the grain, the wine, and the oil,
and my wine in its season,
I will take away my wool and my flax,
which were to cover her nakedness.
in the sight of her lovers,
and no one shall rescue her out of my hand.
And I will put an end to all her mirth,
I will lay waste her vines and her fig trees,
which my lovers have given me.
I will make them a forest,
and the beasts of the field shall devour them.
the feast days of the Baals
when she burned offerings to them
adorned herself with her ring and jewelry,
Therefore, behold, I will allure her,
And there I will give her her vineyards
and make the Valley of Achor
as in the days of her youth,
as at the time when she came out of the land of Egypt.
and no longer will you call me
I will remove the names of the Baals from her mouth, and they shall be remembered by name no more.

and they shall answer the earth,

loves the children of Israel, though they turn to other gods and love cakes of raisins.

dwell as mine for many days. You shall not play the whore, or belong to another man; so will I also be to you.

has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land.
There is no faithfulness or steadfast love,
no knowledge of God in the land;
there is swearing, lying, murder, stealing, and committing adultery;
and all who dwell in it languish,
and also the beasts of the field
and the birds of the heavens,
and even the fish of the sea are taken away.
the prophet also shall stumble with you by night;
from being a priest to me.
And since you have forgotten the law of your God,
I also will forget your children.
the more they sinned against me;

they are greedy for their iniquity.
And it shall be like people, like priest;
I will punish them for their ways
and repay them for their deeds.
They shall eat, but not be satisfied;
they shall play the whore, but not multiply,
inquire of a piece of wood,
and their walking staff gives them oracles.
a spirit of whoredom has led them astray,
and they have left their God to play the whore.
They sacrifice on the tops of the mountains
and burn offerings on the hills,
Therefore your daughters play the whore,
I will not punish your daughters when they play the whore,
nor your brides when they commit adultery;
the men themselves go aside with prostitutes
without understanding shall come to ruin.
Though you play the whore, O
like a lamb in a broad pasture?
When their drink is gone, they give themselves to whoring;
be ashamed because of their sacrifices.

chapter.heading: Punishment Coming for Israel and Judah

#text: Pay attention, O house of Israel!
Give ear, O house of the king!
For the judgment is for you;
you have been a snare at Mizpah
I will discipline all of them.
and Israel is not hidden from me;
for now, O Ephraim, you have played the whore;
Their deeds do not permit them
the spirit of whoredom is within them,
The pride of Israel testifies to his face;
Ephraim shall stumble in his guilt;
Judah also shall stumble with them.
With their flocks and herds they shall go
but they will not find him;
They have dealt faithlessly with the
for they have borne alien children.
Now the new moon shall devour them with their fields.
I make known what is sure.
The princes of Judah have become
upon them I will pour out
because he was determined to go after filth.
like dry rot to the house of Judah.
and sent to the great king.
But he is not able to cure you
and like a young lion to the house of
I, even I, will tear and go away;
I will carry off, and no one shall rescue.
I will return again to my place,
until they acknowledge their guilt and seek my face,
in their distress earnestly seek me.
he has torn us, that he may heal us;
he has struck us down, and
on the third day he will raise us up,
that we may live before him.
let us press on to know the
his going out is sure as the dawn;
as the spring rains that water the earth.

like the dew that goes early away.
Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets;
by the words of my mouth,
and my judgment goes forth as the light.
the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
there they dealt faithlessly with me.
Gilead is a city of evildoers,
lie in wait for a man,
they murder on the way to
In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing;
I restore the fortunes of my people,
the iniquity of Ephraim is revealed,
and the princes by their treachery.
they are like a heated oven
whose baker ceases to stir the fire,
from the kneading of the dough
became sick with the heat of wine;
he stretched out his hand with mockers.
For with hearts like an oven
in the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.
All of them are hot as an oven,
and none of them calls upon me.
Ephraim is a cake not turned.
gray hairs are sprinkled upon him,
The pride of Israel testifies to his face;
yet they do not return to the
nor seek him, for all this.
I will spread over them my net;
I will bring them down like birds of the heavens;
according to the report made to their congregation.
Woe to them, for they have strayed from me!
Destruction to them, for they have rebelled against me!
They do not cry to me from the heart,
for grain and wine they gash themselves;
I trained and strengthened their arms,
yet they devise evil against me.
their princes shall fall by the sword
like a vulture is over the house of the
They set up princes, but I knew it not.
With their silver and gold they made idols
How long will they be incapable of innocence?
and they shall reap the whirlwind.
The standing grain has no heads;
already they are among the nations
they have gone up to Assyria,
Though they hire allies among the nations,
I will soon gather them up.
they have become to him altars for sinning.
Were I to write for him my laws by the ten thousands,
they would be regarded as a strange thing.
they sacrifice meat and eat it,
Now he will remember their iniquity
I will send a fire upon his cities,
and it shall devour her strongholds.
for you have played the whore, forsaking your God.

the new wine shall fail them.
they shall eat unclean food in Assyria.

and their sacrifices shall not please him.
all who eat of it shall be defiled;

For behold, they are going away from destruction;
thorns shall be in their tents.
The days of punishment have come;
the days of recompense have come;
the man of the spirit is mad,
the watchman of Ephraim with my God;
a fowler's snare is on all his ways,
and hatred in the house of his God.
Like the first fruit on the fig tree
consecrated themselves to the thing of shame,
became detestable like the thing they loved.
glory shall fly away like a bird—
no birth, no pregnancy, no conception!
Even if they bring up children,
I will bereave them till none is left.

there I began to hate them.

I will love them no more;

because they have not listened to him;

but they did not know that
I led them with cords of kindness,

return to the land of Egypt,

consume the bars of their gates,
they call out to the Most High,

How can I give you up, O Ephraim?
How can I hand you over, O Israel?
my compassion grows warm and tender.
I will not execute my burning anger;
I will not again destroy Ephraim;
for I am God and not a man,
the Holy One in your midst,
and I will not come in wrath.

and there God spoke with us—

And now they sin more and more,
idols skillfully made of their silver,

like the dew that goes early away,

you know no God but me,

they were filled, and their heart was lifted up;

like a bear robbed of her cubs;

Where now is your king, to save you in all your cities?

I gave you a king in my anger,
I took him away in my wrath.
The pangs of childbirth come for him,
but he is an unwise son,
for at the right time he does not present himself
at the opening of the womb.
I shall ransom them from the power of Sheol;
I shall redeem them from Death.
Compassion is hidden from my eyes.
he may flourish among his brothers,

to the work of our hands.

for my anger has turned from them.
I will be like the dew to Israel;
he shall blossom like the lily;
he shall take root like the trees
they shall flourish like the grain;
they shall blossom like the vine;
their fame shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
Ephraim, what have I to do with idols?
It is I who answer and look after you.
I am like an evergreen cypress;

whoever is discerning, let him know them;
